resources.string: Thank you for agreeing to test out the new TouchFreeLibrary interface.\n\nBefore we begin the tests, let\'s run a brief tutorial to show you how the interface works.

It is now time to practice your skills. On the next screen, you will see a series of arrows. Make gestures in the direction of these arrows until you feel substantially comfortable. After that, you will perform an identical activity, only this time your results will be recorded. Feel free to take as long as you need to in the practice round.
Some applications using TouchFreeLibrary will have users click without actually touching the screen. One of the input methods provided is a clap sensor. Try clapping to get to the next screen.

Another feature programs using TouchFreeLibrary have access to is a cursor that emulates tapping using gestures and some sort of click sensor, in this case, claps. To move the cursor, use your directional gestures. To stop the cursor, go in the opposite direction.

 A cursor has been conviently placed on this screen. Feel free to mess around with it until you feel comfortable moving it around.

 When you're finished, clap to start the next activity.

That's all!

 Thanks for testing some of the TouchFreeLibrary interfaces. You're efforts will not have been in vain.

 Sincerely,

 Leeran Z. Raphaely
